channel.title: tidyverse on Dylan McKenna - Fundamentals of Analytics
channel.description: Recent content in tidyverse on Dylan McKenna - Fundamentals of Analytics

item.title: Final Project
item.description: Description of Dataset The dataset used for this project is the Daily Weather in the U.S., 2017. The data is collected by 1589 stations throughout the United States and Canada. The collected data consists of 15 variables; however, only 8 variables were used for this project. How does the temperature change with latitude? Maximum temperature and latitude Average Temp by Latitude Average Temp by Elevation Precipitation by Elevation

item.title: Assignment 05 - Exploratory Data Analysis - V2
item.description: Assignmnet 5 - Exploratory Data Analysis This is the submission for Assignment 5 - EDA. Dataset: City of Chicago - Crime - 2001 to Present The dataset used for this assignment was the City of Chicago Crime Statistics data. To reduce the file size, the data is reflective of the year 2019 and the year 2020. This data is taken from the Chicago Police Departments publicly available data.

item.title: Assignment 04 - Using ShinyApp
item.description: Assignment 4 - Using ShinyApp This assignment involved creating an interactive post with ShinyApp. Click Here for ShinyApp! You can download the dataset below. Homeruns per Team The following chart shows the amount of homeruns (HR) per team in each year. The Top 5 Teams are highlighted. An interesting observation is that the HR leaders in early 2000’s were much higher than the years afterward. One possible reason for the decrease of HR’s could be that steroid testing began during the 2003 season.

item.title: Assignment A02: TIDYVERSE
item.description: Assignment 02: TIDYVERSE This assignment is to better understand Tidyverse. One Table Verbs and Two Table Verbs Changing variable type using mutate. batting <- batting %>% mutate( GIDP = as.double(GIDP), Avg. = H / AB) fielding <- fielding %>% mutate( lgID = as.character(lgID)) Combine master into batting and into fielding. # Join master list into the batting list to show the players name. batting_full <- left_join(batting, master_name, join = "playerID") ## Joining, by = "playerID" # Join master list into the fielding list to show players name.

item.title: Data Wrangling using Tidyverse
item.description: Import the hotels.csv file library(tidyverse) ## -- Attaching packages --------------------------------------- tidyverse 1.3.1 -- ## v ggplot2 3.3.3 v purrr 0.3.4 ## v tibble 3.1.1 v dplyr 1.0.6 ## v tidyr 1.1.3 v stringr 1.4.0 ## v readr 1.4.0 v forcats 0.5.1 ## -- Conflicts ------------------------------------------ tidyverse_conflicts() -- ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() hotels <- read_csv("hotels.csv") ## ## -- Column specification -------------------------------------------------------- ## cols( ## .
